title: Post-Quantum Cryptographic Protocols for Resource-Constrained IoT
description: Designing and implementing quantum-resistant cryptographic protocols optimized for resource-constrained IoT devices. Addressing the coming post-quantum transition in IoT security.

content.title: Post-Quantum Cryptographic Protocols for Resource-Constrained IoT

sections.title: Project Overview
sections.content: This research addresses one of the most pressing challenges in IoT security: preparing for the post-quantum era. As quantum computers become more powerful, current cryptographic protocols will become vulnerable, potentially compromising billions of IoT devices worldwide.

sections.title: Technical Approach
sections.content: We focus on developing lightweight implementations of NIST-standardized post-quantum algorithms, specifically optimized for IoT devices with severe memory and computational constraints. Our approach includes protocol design, implementation optimization, and real-world validation.

sections.title: Expected Outcomes
sections.content: This work will contribute directly to NIST standardization efforts and provide practical guidance for IoT manufacturers preparing for the post-quantum transition. We expect to publish open-source implementations and evaluation frameworks.
